cooking_method: Boil the spaghetti until al dente, then mix with a sauce made from bacon, eggs, parmesan cheese, and black pepper.
Rub the chicken with butter, lemon, garlic, and thyme, then roast in the oven until golden brown.
Brown the beef, then simmer with carrots, potatoes, onions, and beef broth until tender.
Stir-fry the vegetables with soy sauce until tender, then serve over rice or noodles.
Brush the salmon with olive oil, then bake in the oven until cooked through. Serve with a sauce made from dill, lemon, and yogurt.
Blend basil, pine nuts, garlic, and olive oil to make a pesto sauce, then toss with cooked pasta.
Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices, then cook in a sauce made from tomatoes, onions, and garam masala.
Cook the shrimp in butter, garlic, and lemon until pink, then garnish with parsley.
Brown the beef and bacon, then simmer with red wine, carrots, and onions until tender.
Cook soba noodles and toss with cucumber, carrots, sesame seeds, and soy sauce.
Place salmon in a baking dish and top with lemon, garlic, butter, and dill. Bake in the oven until cooked through.
Cook chicken with bell peppers, onions, and taco seasoning, then serve with warm tortillas.
Cook ground beef and rice, then stuff into bell peppers with tomatoes and cheese. Bake in the oven until peppers are tender.
Spread pesto on bread, add mozzarella cheese and tomato, then grill in butter until cheese is melted.
Season chicken with spices and cook in a pan until golden brown. Assemble tacos with chicken, avocado, lettuce, sour cream, hot sauce, and lime juice.
Marinate salmon fillet with lemon juice, garlic, salt, and black pepper. Arrange asparagus on a baking dish, add salmon on top, and bake in the oven. Drizzle with olive oil before serving.
Saute beef sirloin and mushrooms until brown. Add onion, beef broth, and sour cream. Serve over cooked egg noodles with a dollop of sour cream and a sprinkle of parsley.

Chop lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, and red onion into bite-sized pieces. Add crumbled feta cheese and kalamata olives. Dress with a mixture of lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and black pepper. Toss and serve.
